message:
[Action Options]
1) MOVE <target>, <target> can only be a cube.
2) SWEEP <target>, this moves the groom so it pushes the <target> into dustpan, only Bob can SWEEP, Alice must WAIT in front of the same <target> cube when Bob SWEEP.
3) WAIT, stays at the current spot.
4) DUMP, only when there are one or more cubes in the dustpan, Alice can DUMP it into trash_bin.
Only SWEEP a cube after both robots MOVEed to the cube.
[Action Output Instruction]
Think step-by-step about your plan and output your idea, and then output 'EXECUTE
', then give exactly one action per robot, put each on a new line.
Example#1:Think: Let's start with the blue_cube_1 since it's the closest to us current. After that, I will WAIT while you SWEEP the blue_cube_1 into the dustpan.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION MOVE blue_cube_1
NAME Bob ACTION MOVE blue_cube_1
Example#2:Think: Alice,since there are three cubes inside the dustpan.You can DUMP these cubes into the trash_bin while I WAIT.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION DUMP
NAME Bob ACTION WAIT
Example#3:Think: Bob, since we are both in front of the green_cube_1 and it's less than 0.15 away from us, you can SWEEP the green_cube_1 while I WAIT into the dustpan.
Action: EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION WAIT
NAME Bob ACTION SWEEP green_cube_1
[Task Description]
Robot Alice and Bob need collaborate to sweep all yellow cube and green cube on the table and dump to the trash_bin as quickly as possible.
Alice is a robot holding a dustpan, Bob is a robot holding a broom, together they must sweep up all yellow and green cubes on the table.
To sweep up a cube, Alice must place the dustpan to one side, while Bob must sweep the cube from the other side into the dustpan.
Please output the actions most suitable for robots Alice and Bob to complete this task.
Improve your plans if given [Environment Feedback].
Respond very concisely but informatively.
Propose exactly one action per robot at the **current** round, select from [Action Options].
End your response must strictly follow [Action Output Instruction]!
At the current round:        
[Env State]
green_cube_1 is at (1.23, 0.49, 0.17), on the table; 
yellow_cube_1 is at (0.06, 0.56, 0.17), on the table; 
blue_cube_1 is at (-0.08, 0.41, 0.17), on the table; 
pink_cube_1 is at (0.61, 0.56, 0.17), on the table; 
green_cube_2 is at (1.47, 0.49, 0.17), on the table; 
yellow_cube_2 is at (1.01, 0.43, 0.17), on the table; 
red_cube_1 is at (0.29, 0.45, 0.17), on the table; 
green_cube_3 is at (-0.39, 0.40, 0.17), on the table; 
yellow_cube_3 is at (0.79, 0.59, 0.17), on the table;
[Agent State]
Alice's gripper is at (0.29, -0.07, 0.51), holding dustpan, in front of green_cube_1 with distance: 1.05, in front of yellow_cube_1 with distance: 0.49, in front of blue_cube_1 with distance: 0.49, in front of pink_cube_1 with distance: 0.57, in front of green_cube_2 with distance: 1.27, in front of yellow_cube_2 with distance: 0.83, in front of red_cube_1 with distance: 0.37, in front of green_cube_3 with distance: 0.73, in front of yellow_cube_3 with distance: 0.71
Bob's gripper is at (1.16, 0.81, 0.83), holding broom, in front of green_cube_1 with distance: 0.42, in front of yellow_cube_1 with distance: 1.15, in front of blue_cube_1 with distance: 1.32, in front of pink_cube_1 with distance: 0.65, in front of green_cube_2 with distance: 0.52, in front of yellow_cube_2 with distance: 0.48, in front of red_cube_1 with distance: 0.97, in front of green_cube_3 with distance: 1.62, in front of yellow_cube_3 with distance: 0.49

Think about the task at hand and plan actions for all agents in ['Alice', 'Bob'], and output exactly in the format of the given case.
Your answer is:

Think: Bob is closest to green_cube_2, and Alice is at a reasonable distance to move to it as well. Let's start with green_cube_2 since it's a target cube and both robots can reach it quickly. Alice will MOVE to green_cube_2 and Bob will also MOVE to green_cube_2 to prepare for sweeping.

Action: EXECUTE
NAME Alice ACTION MOVE green_cube_2
NAME Bob ACTION MOVE green_cube_2
